poem:
Title: In the Depths of Liquid Debt

Liquid debt creeps, a rising spectre 
In London's cloistered nest.
A babe, unversed in fiscal contest,
Teethes at Mother Thames's breast.
He drinks in centuries, not knowing
In his small home's tap-flowing despair,
A million cups of tea are owing,
Swimming in their airless prayer.
One might wonder, upon reading this sordid tale,
Who gains from such a watery wail?
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. I live in London with my husband and baby and we have received a £1,100 bill from Thames Water for our two-bedroom flat. We moved into the flat in early 2023 and the latest bill says we used £803 of water in the five months up to the end of September. We also still owe". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
